subject: Design
title: Living Buildings: Architecture That Gives Back
description: A quick win: understand Living Buildings: Architecture That Gives Back.

hook.text: The Living Building Challenge asks: can a building generate more energy and water than it consumes?

buildup.text: Living Buildings must produce all their energy on-site, collect and treat all water, and use non-toxic materials.

discovery.text: The Bullitt Center in Seattle generates 60% more electricity than it uses and treats its own wastewater.

twist.text: Only about 30 buildings worldwide have achieved full Living Building certification. The bar is extremely high.

climax.text: Living Buildings prove that regenerative design â€” giving back more than you take â€” is possible.

punchline.text: The ultimate building isn't sustainable. It's generous.

quiz.question: What does the Living Building Challenge require?
options: Buildings must generate more energy and water than they consume
